title: Joyful hedonism
content: But if form is all there is, there is never justification for ever harming another body. And that is the light that will lead us out of this rotten, brain-damaged culture…Into a life of joyful hedonism…
creator: Eliza Daley
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Revisiting the Nova Scotia Flax to Linen Ecosystem
content: New fibre eco systems will always be place-based and context driven and every instance will likely be different depending on the history, land, culture and personalities of the residents.
creator: Zoe Gilbertson
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Ditching Dualist Language
content: The point is not to advocate a sudden new language, but to become more aware of the dualistic impositions deeply woven and perpetuated into modern life, through language. The point is to recognize the prison bars and the constant brainwashing rhetoric issuing from the speakers in the asylum of modernity… and to dislike the situation.
creator: Tom Murphy
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Uncomfortable Questions in Unstable Times
content: This week’s Frankly marks a new recurring segment on this platform where Nate poses questions about our shared future: Uncomfortable Questions in Unstable Times. In this edition, he explores what would change if societies shifted their primary goal from growth to stability.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Ragnarök revisited
content: We don’t really see the violence that historically underlay and still underlies the globalised ‘free’ trade that defines the modern world because a lot of effort has gone into forgetting it. Better, I’d argue, to embrace the role of the settled local farmer-householder (which in fact many of the Vikings were too) who knows how to produce their own livelihood from the land.
creator: Chris Smaje
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Empire Crumbles Part II: Creative Dissidence and Mutual Aid
content: Currently, global breakdown is being accelerated primarily by an ongoing and worsening political calamity in the United States. In this article, we’ll go to the frontlines of conflict in Minneapolis to see how people are responding to a violent—even deadly—government-imposed crisis.
creator: Richard Heinberg
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The chemical society and its discontents: Ozone layer edition
content: The solutions to our problems so often simply create more and different problems.
creator: Kurt Cobb
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Misunderstood History of CO2: The Science Behind Earth’s Most Controversial Molecule
content: In this episode, Nate is joined by science journalist Peter Brannen, who reframes CO2 from an industrial pollutant to a miraculous substance whose critical role within the carbon cycle makes Earth habitable.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Healing the Earth, One Community at a Time: Highlighting  ERC’s Global Impact
content: Eight years ago, the Ecosystem Restoration Communities (ERC) movement began with a simple but powerful belief: that everyday people everywhere could restore the land beneath their feet and, in doing so, restore hope for our shared future.
creator: Ecosystem Restoration Communities Staff
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Humanity Is Not the Problem!
content: True climate action doesn’t require vast data centers, billions of liters of water, or mineral-intensive hardware. It requires shorter distances, stronger communities, healthy soils, local food webs, and diverse, place-based economies that reduce demand at the source.
creator: Helena Norberg-Hodge
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Why Scientists Are Still Puzzled by Consciousness
content: Despite several theories proposed by scientists and philosophers, there are no conclusive answers.
creator: Leslie Alan Horvitz
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: Big Tech Accused of AI ‘Greenwashing’
content: The big tech industry’s claims about the climate benefits of artificial intelligence (AI) are largely unproven and unsubstantiated, according to a new report from a coalition of climate advocacy and accountability groups.
creator: Joey Grostern
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: We All Need To Go To Business School
content: Ten years ago, I started teaching at Bard’s Green MBA Program, where I now teach classes in economics, economic development, community investment funds, and “sustaining mission.” And what I can report is that the several hundred students I taught have created, run, or improved an amazing assortment of mission-oriented enterprises.
creator: Michael Shuman
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: National Security
content: One thing is clear—when politicians invoke the phrase “national security,” they are never talking about security for the people who live in this country.
creator: Mary Wildfire
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.

title: The Future is Rural: Reclaiming Food Sovereignty through Farming Clubs?
content: In this episode, Nate is joined by biologist and farmer Jason Bradford, to discuss his ‘Farming Club,’ which offers hands-on learning for ecologically based agriculture, where members also get to take home food and build a relationship with the land.
creator: Nate Hagens
sourceDescription: Insight and inspiration in turbulent times.
